intro: Conostalix graminea, commonly known as the slender conostalix, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
